Zann Takes Afternoons At Seattle's KISS FM; 'Mayhem' Comes To Middays And APD/MD Duties

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ 106.1 KISS FM, Seattle announced that Zann will join the station as its afternoon drive on-air host, effective immediately. She'll air from 3pm-7pm. Zann arrives from Dallas, where she most recently served as the midday host at KLIF-FM and Westwood Oneâs Hot AC and Hits Now. She has also served as an afternoon drive host in New York City. She began her career as a morning show producer in Philadelphia. âI feel like this is what it would have felt like had I been asked to prom,â said Zann. âIn every market Iâve worked in, iHeartMedia was the market to beat. Thank you to everyone at iHeartMediaâs Pacific Northwest Division for giving me the opportunity to be the one to beat in Seattle!â

Also announced was that Zach âMayhemâ Wellsandt will join the station as Assistant Program Director and Music Director in addition to his new Midday host responsibilities. Wellsandt joins iHeartMedia Seattle from iHeartMediaâs Central Texas region, where he most recently served as the Director of CHR. His background includes Program Director roles in Austin, Grand Rapids and Spokane, where he began his career. âWe couldnât be happier to welcome Zann and Zach to Seattle,â said Tim Herbster, Regional Senior Vice President of Programming for iHeartMedia Pacific Northwest. âZannâs dynamic personality is always on display with her unique ability to engage and connect with audiences on and off the air."

PROGRAMMING: Greg Neft Named Program Director For Powertalk A/F Fresno

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ iHeartMedia has named Greg Neft named Program Director for KALZ-PowerTalk 96.7 and KRZR- AM 1400, Fresno. and will report to Steve Weed, Senior Vice President of Programming for iHeartMedia Fresno. âGreg joins us at a very opportune time, heading into a crucial election season for our region and our state,â said Weed. âI look forward to his skills and experience elevating our breaking news coverageâ

Neft joins the Market from St. George, Utah where he most recently served as the Corporate Director of News Content Programming for Cherry Creek Media. He returns to Fresno after previously working there as an anchor and reporter. Neft also served as the Morning News Anchor for WOKV and and NFL reporter for Sirius XM Radio in Jacksonville, Florida. âIâm very pleased to be back in Californiaâs magnificent Central Valley,â said Neft. âAs someone whoâs been privileged to get to know the people, the places and the stories that neighbors are concerned about; Iâm THRILLED to once again serve this wonderful region and join a team that gives 110% every day to make PowerTalk the best News/Talk station in the Fresno/Visalia area.â

Jon Watkins Returns To KEGA Salt Lake City As Program Director

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Jon Watkins held the title for eight years but left the position to focus solely on the morning show on his sister station KUDD-FM. âJonâs passion for The Eagle and Country music never died, even when we moved him over to Top 40. When we saw an opening, we knew that he had to bring him back.â Says Broadway Media GM, Kayvon Motiee.

Jon will continue hosting mornings as well as his new duties. Send your best to him jwatkins@bwaymedia.com

Josh 'Bru' Brubaker Named Local Anchor For Ty, Kelly & Chuck On NASH FM Detroit

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Cumulus has promoted Josh âBruâ Brubaker to Local Anchor for the syndicated âTy, Kelly and Chuckâ Show on NASH FM 93.1/WDRQ-FM in Detroit. In his new role, Brubaker will cover traffic, weather, local contesting and content. Brubaker joined WDRQ in 2017 as a weekend/swing talent and was elevated to production assistant shortly thereafter. Brubaker previously worked for Cumulus Media-Toledo, and at stations in Monroe, MI, and Bad Axe, MI.

Robby Bridges, Director of FM Programming, Cumulus Media-Detroit, said: âBru is one of the most talented young radio guys Iâve heard and we are pumped to have him join Ty, Kelly and Chuck on the Detroit edition of the show every morning on âDRQ.â Brubaker said: âI cannot even believe I get to be on a show in morning drive in Detroit and work with this crew! Thanks to Robby and OM Mike Wheeler for the opportunity!!â

Benztown, a global leader in radio imaging, voiceover services, production libraries, programming and jingles, announced that UK audio imaging professional Sam Wickens, Audio Production Assistant for Capital FM in London, captured the title of Worldâs Best Imager on Friday, May 4, 2018, winning the high stakes 7th Annual Iron Imager competition at the Worldwide Radio Summit held at the W Hollywood Hotel. Wickens, 26, took on 2017 Iron Imager Champion Brad Leask, 24, Network Imaging Producer, NOVA Entertainment, Sydney, Australia, in the head-to-head live audio imaging competition presented annually by Benztown. Iron Imager is the first and only competition of its kind. In the Iron Imager competition, Wickens and Leask demonstrated their world-class imaging skills by producing a promo on Thursday, May 3, for a format unannounced until the day of the live competition. This yearâs format was CHR. The Iron Imager finalists used hand-picked elements from several of Benztownâs 23 production libraries and an original script created by the Benztown team to create their promo in just 60 minutes. Judges for 2018 Iron Imager were: John Candelaria, Program Director, WMGC/105.1 The Bounce-Detroit, MI; Dom Nero, Creative/Imaging Director, WQHT/Hot 97-New York, NY; Readers of the Benztown Imaging Blog. To hear Wickensâ winning promo, visit: https://www.benztown.com/ironimager.

iHeart Chicago Promotes Khatija Mohiuddin & Brian McGhee To GSM Posts

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââÂ iHeartMedia Chicago announced that Khatija Mohiuddin (TL) has been named General Sales Manager for 107.5 WGCI and 103.5 KISS FM and Brian McGhee as General Sales Manager for V103 and Inspiration 1390, effective May 21. Both positions will report to Adam Kurtz, Senior Vice President of Sales for iHeartMediaâs Chicago Region.

âWe put a priority on recognizing our high performers with advancement opportunities and these two staff promotions are true testaments to Khatijaâs and Brianâs leadership skills and ability to form strong client relationships,â said Matt Scarano, President of iHeartMedia Market Groupâs Chicago Region. âBrianâs expertise with heritage urban brands and Khatijaâs continued track record of success will take our region to new heights.â

Mohiuddin most recently served as Local Sales Manager for 107.5 WGCI and Inspiration 1390. Prior to returning to iHeartMedia Chicago in 2016, she served as an Account Executive at WTMX-FM in Chicago. Mohiuddin began her sales career with iHeartMediaâs 93.9 LITE FM in 2005.

McGhee, a Waukegan, IL native, has previously held Account Executive and General Sales Manager positions for Max Media in Carbondale. He has also worked as an Account Executive for iHeartMedia Nashville.

Howard Stern 'Furious' At HBO Over RRHOF Bon Jovi Induction Speech Edit

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Howard Stern was thrilled when Bon Jovi asked him to provide his introduction speech during last month's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland reports nj.com, but was 'furious' of how HBO edited his speech. The shock jock vented for 20 minutes at the beginning his radio show on Monday about how HBO edited his speech. "I really crafted my words, I wanted to make people laugh. I wanted to have a good time," Stern said in the rant. "I really crafted the thing...so some editor could determine if I was funny in places? They were probably like, 'Hey, that's a funny joke, but we gotta cut somewhere.' No you don't have to cut somewhere!"

Stern said that the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame wanted him there so badly they flew him to Cleveland on a private jet for the event. One of Stern's producers suggested that about three minutes of his speech was cut. "Oh yeah, trust me there was another 15 minutes ... I understand they have to edit it down," Stern said, before joking that an intern was probably behind the edits. "You can't fly me to f***ing Cleveland and ask me to make a speech and then edit the s*** out of me," Stern said. "I wasn't there talking about my career. I spent a lot of time on that and they spent three minutes deciding what should be in and out...They completely...gutted me. Like a rotting fish, which I am. That's how I feel inside."

NETWORKS: Paul Shaffer Named 3rd Annual Music Industry Awards Emcee

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Canadian Music Week has announced that Envision NetworksÂ®â Paul Shafferâs Day in Rock host, Paul Shaffer, will be master of ceremonies at the 3rd Annual Live Music Industry Awards in Toronto. The awards show will take place on Friday May 11 as part of CMWâs Live Music Summit conference at the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel. Shaffer served as David Lettermanâs sidekick and bandleader for over 30 years and was part of the original Saturday Night Live. You can bring this music legend to your station with the daily vignette series, Paul Shafferâs Day in Rock, which illustrates the history of rock, according to Shaffer.

For information on Paul Shafferâs Day in Rock or other Envision Networks shows, contact us at 216.831.3761 or paulshaffer@envisionnetworks.com.

PODCASTS: It's Now 'Business Unusual' With Shark Tank's Barbara Corcoran And iHeart

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Barbara Corcoran, nine-season Shark on ABCâs âShark Tank,â real estate mogul, author and investor; and iHeartMedia announced the launch of a new original podcast, Business Unusual With Barbara Corcoran on iHeartRadio. They will co-produce 'Business Unusual with Barbara Corcoran,' which will draw on Corcoranâs 30+ years of business expertise, life lessons and Shark Tank anecdotes.

âA lot of people have helped me out in life, offering sage advice, which Iâve made my own, improved upon, or taken advantage of,â said Corcoran, âWith this new podcast, I can pay it forward beyond the pages of a book or a few minutes on TV. Other than writing a love letter, itâs the most intimate way to communicate â just me talking openly with you. Itâs an opportunity to share what I know best.â âBarbara Corcoran is a personality like none other. Her experience as a real estate mogul and business investor, along with her amazing sense of humor and life stories, will make her tips, stories and advice perfect for iHeartRadioâs digital and broadcast listeners nationwide,â said Chris Peterson, Senior Vice President of Podcasting for iHeartMedia. Proud sponsors of the Business Unusual with Barbara Corcoran podcast include Indeed and Dell Small Business.

SNAPS: ABC's Nathanson Hangs With 'Idol

THE MOUTH, MAY 9TH, 2018 ââ Following this week's news of ABC TV extending the new American Idol for a second season, it's judges, Lionel Ritchie, Katy Perry & Luke Bryan were all smiles backstage with ABC Radio entertainment correspondent Jason Nathanson backstage. PHOTO/ABC News.

Help Us Find Radio's Next Rising Stars?

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ ReelWorld, in association with Morning Show Boot Camp 30, is looking to recognize FIVE special personalities who are destined for on-air stardom as winners of its fourth annual Rising Star Awards. NOMINEES ARE BEING ACCEPTED NOW THROUGH MIDNIGHT, JULY 7th.

The ReelWorld Rising Star Awards are open to all candidates, in all formats and market sizes, who have been on-air for at least one year, but not longer than 5 years, in either a supporting or leading role. Our goal is to recognize those lesser known personalities who rarely, if ever, receive press and are unknown to most radio professionals beyond their colleagues or employers. A select panel of judges will review all nominees for consideration. To enter just click the link below and provide your nominee's name, city and station, brief work history, 2-3 minute mp3/aircheck and a brief explanation of why you believe they deserve consideration for this award. (Yes, you can nominate yourself).

Please include photos and any other supporting material you think is relevant. Winners will be notified after July 17th and formally announced on August 10th at MSBC in Chicago. Good luck future Stars! CLICK HERE TO SUBMIT

Entercom Reports Q1 Financial Results

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Entercom Communications (NYSE: ETM) today reported financial results for the quarter ended March 31, 2018. First Quarter highlights show net revenues for the quarter were $300.6 million, compared to $99.0 million in the first quarter of 2017. On a same-station basis, net revenues for the quarter were $300.6 million compared to $324.9 million in the first quarter of 2017 Operating income for the quarter was $5.7 million, compared to an operating loss of $15.0 million in the first quarter of 2017 Net loss per diluted share for the quarter was ($0.10), compared to net loss per diluted share of ($0.25) in the first quarter of 2017 Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter was $30.1 million, compared to $61.0 million in the first quarter of 2017.

David J. Field, President and CEO stated: âSince closing on our merger in November, we have moved quickly to implement rapid change and have made good progress on our various integration, synergy and transformation goals. We have built a terrific leadership team and are driving strong ratings growth and launching a number of revenue-driving initiatives to capitalize on our scale and compete far more effectively against other media for a larger share of ad spending. Earlier today, we announced the launch of the Entercom Audio Network which will enable us to use our scale to participate directly in the $1 billion network radio market." Launching on July 1, 2018, the network will cover close to 90% of people 12+ in the top 50 markets. READ MORE HERE

Entercom To Enter National Network Arena

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Entercom announced the introduction of the Entercom Audio Network. The national network will allow advertisers to leverage Entercomâs scale with targeted offerings across its portfolio of 235 top-rated radio stations reaching over 112 million listeners monthly. The Entercom Audio Network is set to launch July 1. âAs one of the two largest radio broadcasters in the country, Entercom has the scale and reach to offer national brands a very compelling and effective unwired network with our premier collection of leading radio brands across the country,â said David Field, President and CEO, Entercom. âWe cover close to 90% of people 12+ in the top 50 markets and we continue to invest in the best local brands and personalities to serve our audiences and our communities.â

âEntercom now offers brands the national scale they need, including seamless activation and superior ROI,â said Bob Philips, (L) Chief Revenue Officer, Entercom. âWe are the countryâs unrivaled leader in news and sports radio and #1 or #2 in virtually all music formats. Our connection to consumers is coveted by many national brands.â

Veteran Radio And TV Marketing Executive Marty Wall Joins Cumulus Detroit As Director of Marketing

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Cumulus Media has appointed veteran radio and television marketing executive Marty Wall as Director of Marketing, Cumulus Media-Detroit. Wall, a three time Billboard Magazine Radio Promotion Director of the Year recipient, brings more than 20 years experience to the cluster and will oversee all marketing initiatives for Country radio stations WDRQ/NASH FM 93.1 and NASH ICON/WDRQ-HD2, as well as Hot AC station 96.3 WDVD.

Robby Bridges, Director of FM Programming, Cumulus Media-Detroit, said: âMartyâs work at Z100 in New York is legendary. That, paired with his experience across the media landscape during his years in L.A., gives him the unique ability to connect audiences to station brands and brands to clients. Heâs a relentless competitor whom I believe will be a game changer for our Detroit cluster. Iâm looking forward to his working with me, Promotion Manager Rochelle Burk and Promo Director/Street Team Captain Adam Ficorelli.â Wall said: âI am thrilled to join Cumulus and Robbyâs team in one of the most competitive radio markets in America. I want to thank him and Mike Wheeler for the opportunity." After 20 years in Los Angeles working for top creative agencies and both domestic and international television networks, Wall recently returned to his hometown of Detroit to be closer to family. He credits much of his career success to mentors including Scott Shannon, Steve Kingston, Pat Martin and Alan Burns. Wallâs radio experience includes five years at Z100 in New York, the launch of WQHT Hot 97 in New York, and WRQX/Q107 in Washington, D.C.

PROGRAMMING: Matt Johnson Named PD For KSLZ/St. Louis

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Matt Johnson has been named Program Director for Z107.7, KSLZ-FM effective immediately. âMatt is a solid addition to the KSLZ and iHeart St. Louis team. We look forward to watching him grow this heritage CHR brand.â noted SVPP Jules Riley. âWe spoke with a number of talented programmers, but Mattâs drive, creativity and talent development made him our ideal candidate.â Matt Johnson has been successfully programming Top 40 for over 15 years including stops at WDKF/Dayton, WXKB/Ft. Myers, and KUDD/Salt Lake City.

Johnson remarked, "I am truly honored to lead such a heritage brand as KSLZ into it's next phase. Big thanks to Jules Riley, Derrick Martin, Greg Chance, and Maynard for giving me this opportunity. I'm excited to get to work with Jordan and the rest of the team in St. Louis. #GoCards"

ON-AIR: Scotty Davis Switches To Country For Afternoons At US 103.5 Tampa

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââÂ Scotty Davis has been named Afternoon Host for iHeart's US103.5, effective Monday May 14th. âI am excited to have someone as talented as Scotty Davis join our team,â said Cindy Spicer, Program Director for US103.5. âHe is well known in the market and is a proven winner in Tampa Bay!â Scotty Davis joins US 103.5 from iHeartMedia Tampa Bayâs 93.3 FLZ, where he has served as the afternoon host for the past six years.

âIâve been eying a move over to the country format for quite some time,â said Davis. âThis is a natural next step for my career and Iâm thankful to everyone at iHeartMedia for believing in me!â

PODCASTS: ESPN's '30 for 30 Podcasts' To Debut Its First Serialized Season On The Complicated World Of 'Bikram Yoga'

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââÂ The third season of ESPNâs 30 for 30 Podcasts launches May 22 with five episodes covering the story of the rise and fall of Bikram yoga, and how the community is still grappling with its identity in the wake of the sexual assault allegations against its founder Bikram Choudhury. A new video trailer that gives a sneak peek at the new season is available now on espn.com and 30for30podcasts.com, and an audio trailer is available in the 30 for 30 Podcasts feed.

Reported and produced by ESPNâs Julia Lowrie Henderson, the series explores how this young Indian yogi used his connections with celebrities to launch a hot yoga empire that changed yoga in America forever. Today, there is a warrant for Choudhuryâs arrest and he has filed for bankruptcy and left the country. Henderson, having practiced and worked in the Bikram Yoga community, uses her experience to help listeners get inside a deeply private community.

SYNDICATION: WBAL-AM Baltimore Adds The Dana Show To Weekend Line-Up

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Radio America announced the addition of The Dana Show Weekend to WBAL-AM, Saturdays 7P-10P ET. The Dana Show is also heard on other stations nationwide like: WOKV-AM & FM Jacksonville, FL, WHIO-AM & FM in Dayton, OH, WIBC-FM Indianapolis, WDBO-FM Orlando, and WSB-AM & FM in Atlanta.

According to Steve Graham, VP for Affiliate Marketing at Radio America, "WBAL-AM is a powerhouse talk station. We know Dana will compliment their strong weekend line-up. This is an exciting opportunity to partner with the Hearst team in Baltimore."

AWARDS: Entercom Honored With Six Stevie Awards Among 3,700 Noms'

THE MOUTH, MAY 8TH, 2018 ââ Entercom was named the winner of six StevieÂ® Awards in The 16th Annual American Business AwardsÂ® across marketing and public relations categories. The Corporate Marketing and the Corporate Communications and PR departments were recognized for their strategic branding and positioning campaigns during Entercomâs 2017 merger with CBS Radio. The American Business Awards is the premier business awards program. All organizations operating in the United States are eligible to submit nominations â public and private, for-profit and non-profit, large and small. More than 3,700 nominations were submitted this year for consideration in a wide range of categories.

Entercom was recognized in the following categories: Gold Stevie Award for: Â· Communications/PR Campaign of the Year (Small Budget) Silver Stevie Award for: Â· Marketing Department of the Year Bronze Stevie Award for: Â· Communications Campaign of the Year â Corporate Communications Â· Communications Campaign of the Year â Reputation/Brand Management Â· Marketing Campaign of the Year (Small Budget) Additionally, Esther-Mireya Tejeda, Head of Corporate Communications and PR at Entercom, was honored as the Communications Executive of the Year with a Silver Stevie Award. Details about The American Business Awards and the list of 2018 Stevie winners are available at www.StevieAwards.com/ABA.
